sen.j: 菅坂峠（すがさかとうげ）とは京都府舞鶴市と綾部市の間にある峠である。
sen.e: Sugasaka-toge Pass is a mountain pass located between Maizuru City and Ayabe City in Kyoto Prefecture.
Sugasaka-toge Pass is a mountain pass located between Maizuru City and Ayabe City in Kyoto Prefecture.
Sugasaka-toge Pass is a mountain pass located between Maizuru City and Ayabe City in Kyoto Prefecture.
It has an elevation of 448 meters.
It has an elevation of 448 meters.
It has an elevation of 448 meters.

sen.j: 菅坂峠は京都府道51号舞鶴和知線にあり、京都府北部の中心都市である舞鶴と、歴史的に深いつながりがある綾部市上林地区を結んでいる。
sen.e: It is on Kyoto Prefectural Road 51 Maizuru Wachi Route linking Maizuru, a major city in northern Kyoto Prefecture, and Kanbayashi area of Ayabe City which has historically strong ties with Maizuru.
It is on Kyoto Prefectural Road 51 Maizuru Wachi Route linking Maizuru, a major city in northern Kyoto Prefecture, and Kanbayashi area of Ayabe City which has historically strong ties with Maizuru.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: It is on Kyoto Prefectural Road 51 Maizuru Wachi Route linking Maizuru, a major city in northern Kyoto Prefecture, and Kanbayashi area of Ayabe City which has historically strong ties with Maizuru.

sen.j: しかし道幅が狭く、急勾配、急カーブが連続する悪路であり、1995年（平成7年）より菅坂南トンネル（延長953ｍ）を含む延長2.3ｋｍのバイパス道路事業（菅坂バイパス）を進めた。
sen.e: The pass, however, was a rough and narrow road with a series of steep slopes and sharp curves, so a bypass project to extend the road by 2.3 kilometers (including the 953-meter-extension with Sugasaka Minami Tunnel) was started in 1995.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The pass, however, was a rough and narrow road with a series of steep slopes and sharp curves, so a bypass project to extend the road by 2.3 kilometers (including the 953-meter-extension with Sugasaka Minami Tunnel) was started in 1995 (Sugasaka Bypass).

The pass, however, was a rough and narrow road with a series of steep slopes and sharp curves, so a bypass project to extend the road by 2.3 kilometers (including the 953-meter-extension with Sugasaka Minami Tunnel) was started in 1995 (Sugasaka Bypass).
Accordingly Sugasaka Bypass was opened on November 8, 2006.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Accordingly Sugasaka Bypass was opened on November 8, 2006.
Accordingly Sugasaka Bypass was opened on November 8, 2006.

sen.j: 菅坂バイパスの開通により、冬期の通行規制が飛躍的に緩和され、両都市間の交流が更に促進されることが期待される。
sen.e: Sugasaka Bypass is expected to promote exchanges between the two cities, by alleviating the conventional traffic regulations in winter.
Sugasaka Bypass is expected to promote exchanges between the two cities, by alleviating the conventional traffic regulations in winter drastically.
Sugasaka Bypass is expected to promote exchanges between the two cities, by alleviating the conventional traffic regulations in winter drastically.
